items.text: through the fielder lunging to his left at short fine leg. It's Shenwari, a hero not so long ago. This length ball slides into his pad and he tickles it fine. Shenwari can't get down quickly enough to his left
items.shortText: Rashid Khan to Imrul Kayes, FOUR runs

items.text: length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket off the front foot
items.shortText: Rashid Khan to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: looks like Mushfiqur could be run out at the non-striker's end! It hinges on whether Rashid knocked the stumps out with his hips...looks like the tricep and elbow area on slow-mo replay. He has the ball in his hand so this will go his way! Mushfiqur Rahim is gone. Rashid picked up the throw from the leg side in front of the stumps and was falling backwards as he collected the throw and looked to take out the stumps. As a result there was some element of him falling onto the stumps but in the end it is all clean. The hip was nowhere close to the stumps. But once again, atrocious running. Kayes had blocked this googly into the square leg region. He didn't want the run. Mushfiq was past halfway because he wanted it. Had no chance of making it back. Once again, no calling.
items.shortText: Rashid Khan to Imrul Kayes, OUT

dismissal.text: Mushfiqur Rahim run out (Mohammad Nabi/Rashid Khan) 33 (52b 2x4 1x6) SR: 63.46

items.text: googly outside off, blocked on the front foot
items.postText: Rafsan Rahman: "Pure madness! This is so silly and school boy cricket by Bangladesh."

items.text: short ball outside off, backs away and slaps this firmly to sweeper's right. Nicely played
items.postText:
We've dug up the laws on the use of the arm in the run-out for you:
29.1.1.5 by a fielder with his/her hand or arm, providing that the ball is held in the hand or hands so used, or in the hand of the arm so used.

items.postText: Gnanaguru: "Kayes had entered the team after a long gap... That would have created the communication gap with Mushi"

items.text: full on off stump, driven back down the pitch
items.postText: Ibrahim: "This is not why I wake up at 6 in the morning on a Sunday. Poor cricket, pathetic calling. But was that really out? Rashid disturbed the first bail with his shoulder, and then 2nd bail was out with his elbow. What does the rule say? Does not it have to be below elbow? " --- It wasn't shoulder, it was more tricep area. And no, there's no below-elbow law: 29.1.1.5 by a fielder with his/her hand or arm, providing that the ball is held in the hand or hands so used, or in the hand of the arm so used.

items.postText: Rakesh Sampat: "Except for the first game, Bangladesh has consistently played silly cricket and has simply failed to do anything sensible on the field. They began with so much promise and suddenly from game 2, they just disappeared from the tournament and this is just a ghost team going through the motions."
